title: INtopBackup
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Monthly jobs report to be released. And, the White House to host a crypto event

items.title: The job market is still pretty solid -- but there are warning signs ahead
items.description: U.S. employers added 151,000 jobs in February, while the unemployment rate inched up to 4.1% from 4% in January.

items.title: Federal judge to hear arguments over whether to block immigration arrests in US schools

items.title: Paris train services to resume after WW2 bomb defused
items.description: The unexploded bomb was found on tracks near the Gare du Nord on Friday.

items.title: Several dead after UN helicopter shot at in South Sudan
items.description: The shooting during an evacuation mission may constitute a war crime, a UN official says.

items.title: Paul Tazewell on vision behind "Wicked" costume transformation
items.description: From dreaming under Ohio stars to reimagining Oz, Paul Tazewell became the first Black man to win a costume design at the Oscars.

items.title: Worst violence in Syria since Assad fall as dozens killed in clashes
items.description: A group that has been monitoring the civil war said 71 people died in clashes between the two sides.

items.title: Donald Tusk announces military training plan for all Polish men
items.description: Poland's prime minister said his government plans to have a model ready by the end of the year.

items.title: Trump says he's considering Russia sanctions until Ukraine ceasefire is reached
items.description: President Trump said in a social media post that Russia and Ukraine should get to the negotiating table "right now."

items.title: Ros Atkins on... the week after the Oval Office row
items.description: The BBC's Analysis Editor Ros Atkins takes a look at the situation on the ground in Ukraine.

items.title: She got her dream job at CDC back. But she's already moving on
items.description: An unknown number of fired CDC workers got their jobs back this week. Among them was Bri McNulty, who had shared her story with NPR.

items.title: Trump says he sent letter to Iran leader calling for nuclear negotiations
items.description: As Iran's nuclear program advances, the country's foreign minister says Tehran won't negotiate under President Trump's "maximum pressure."

items.title: Detroit Zoo's "super fluffy" baby penguin has outgrown his parents
items.description: The baby penguin is just 6 months old and the same weight as an average toddler.
